subject: Parenting
title: The Rise of Pediatrics
description: A quick, practical guide to The Rise of Pediatrics.

hook.text: Before 1850, there were no children's doctors. Sick children saw the same physician who treated horses.

buildup.text: Pediatrics as a medical specialty emerged in the mid-19th century as child mortality soared.

discovery.text: Abraham Jacobi founded the first children's clinic in New York in 1860 â€” treating kids as patients, not small adults.

twist.text: The shift was revolutionary: children have different physiology, different diseases, and different needs.

climax.text: Pediatric care cut child mortality from 30% to under 1% in developed countries within 150 years.

punchline.text: Treating children as children â€” not small adults â€” saved millions of lives.
